info.title: eBrevia API v0
info.description:
Accelerate your diligence with eBrevia's intelligent analytics API.

# Introduction

The eBrevia API allows you to access general account information and intelligent analytics programmatically. The current API is very easy to use for writing and testing applications. You can access the URL endpoints in a browser or via any HTTP client.

# Base URL & Versioning

All API urls are currently on version 0, and have the following common base:

https://yourserver.ebrevia.com/api/v0

Where yourserver should be replaced by the server where you run eBrevia. For example, the UK server might be:

 https://uk.ebrevia.com 

The API will evolve with future releases of eBrevia to become more restful and even easier to use, so API calls are versioned to ensure that clients don't break. The API has an open schema model, it ignores any extra query parameters, and may add extra properties to responses in future releases.

# Authentication

Authentication is handled by basic auth and api key. Users with admin priviledge can generate api key in the admin panel of the web application interface. Regenerate API key replaces an existing API key. You can then include the api key in the Authorization header with the following format:

Authorization Type  | Username | Password
----------------|-------------|-------------
Basic Auth | client API key | left empty

# Status Codes

The API uses conventional HTTP status codes to indicate the success or failure of an API call. In general, codes in the 2xx range indicate success, codes in the 4xx range indicate a client error, and codes in 5xx indicates a server error. The current applied status codes are:

HTTP Response Status Code  | Message
----------------|-------------
200 | Success
400 | Bad request
401 | Not authorized
403 | Forbidden

200.description: No JSON or text output. User deleted successfully.

patch.description: Can only update user's name and roles, and enable/disable user.

matterId.description: -1 to indicate create user in sample project only

send-email.description: if need to send reset-password-link to user's email address

200.description: User info wrapped in an array

get.summary: Get the API requester's non-hidden notifications

patch.summary: Update notifications by notification ID as read, or hidden

200.description: Array of notificationRefIds of notifications that are succesfully updated

delete.description: Deletes a notification, and all references, permanently

200.description: No JSON or text output. Notification deleted successfully.

get.summary: Get an organization by url key
Get a list of accessible projects by the user

matterName.description: full name of the new project

200.description: No JSON or text output. Project deleted successfully.

get.summary: Get a list of custom provisions available in a project.

post.summary: Create a custom field in a project

title.description: Name of the new custom provision.

type.description: Type of the new custom provision.

post.summary: Update a custom field in a project

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New parameters of the custom field

title.description: New name of the custom provision.

delete.summary: Delete a custom field in a project

get.summary: Get a list of summary forms available in a project.
Get a summary form by form id in a project.

post.summary: Update fields in a summary form by form id

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: form id; or "default" to update fields in the default summary form

200.description: A form object with updated field ids

put.summary: Add project access to a user, or update users's role in a project

200.description: No JSON or text output. User added to project successfully.

delete.summary: Revoke project access from a user.

200.description: No JSON or text output. User's access is revoked from project successfully.

get.summary: Get access info of a document or folder in a project

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: for FOLDER type object, this is the full path of folder; for FILE type object, this is the document id

200.description: An array of access info entries.

post.summary: Add access info to a document or folder in a project

object_name.description: for FOLDER type object, this is the full path of folder; for FILE type object, this is the document id.

200.description: An access info entry of a file or folder object.

put.summary: Update access info of a document or folder in a project.

200.description: An access info entry of a file or folder object.
Text info to indicate access is revoked successfully

get.summary: Get all the folders in a project

parameters.name: folder path
parameters.description: location where the new folder will be created

parameters.name: new folder name
parameters.description: name of the new folder to be created

get.summary: Get a list of a projects documents

delete.summary: Delete one or more documents by id

parameters.name: skipTrash
parameters.description: delete document immediately without moving it to trash

200.description: No JSON or text output. Documents deleted successfully.

400.description: Text output shows error messages of deletion failed reasons.

post.summary: Get information about one or more documents

parameters.name: doc-text
parameters.description: include full text of the document

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: pagination parameter: number of documents returned per page, maximum count is 100

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: pagination parameter: start pointer of the next page of documents

data.description: array of data included in the document's summary

docIds.description: array of ids of documents to update

200.description: Array of ids of documents that are succesfully updated

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: group id, which is also the parent doc id of the group

docIds.description: array of child document ids that will be in the group, empty list will remove all documents from the group

200.description: Array of document in the group

parameters.name: data

Fields with updated values

Replace field name with actual field name in the summary

parameters.name: folder path
parameters.description: location where the new folder will be created

200.description: upload a file, return basic info

parameters.description: Download file as pdf, if it exists.If null or false original file will be downloaded

200.description: No JSON output. Specify 'Send and Download' in Postman to test download the report.

post.summary: Download specified files in an archive (ZIP)

asPDF.description: Use pdf version of file if it exists

ocr.description: User ocr or original version of file

200.description: No JSON output. Specify 'Send and Download' in Postman to test download the report.

post.summary: Generate a report based on post data and send it to client for download

200.description: No JSON output. Specify "Send and Download" in Postman to test download the report.
